column4: Hi. After an upgrade to 11.10, the /etc/init/rc?.conf files have gdm in there, and "/etc/X11/default-display-manager" includes a full path to lightdm - all after I indicated to use gdm during upgrade. Now the system simply doesn't boot (waiting for network confuguration, booting without network confuguration, then freezes) and I'm fine with either gdm or lightdm, whatever boots. I also read that lightdm is supposed to be the default one in future releases. W
hat can you suggest to fix this, please?
You could simply purge gdm after booting to text and reinstall lightdm
Would purging gdm and reinstalling lightdm fix the rc files accordingly?
What is great question. Maybe you right, first reinstall lightdm and update.rc
Is there a way to automate that, eg. something that could update the rc files for me?
My idea was test if it is really rc issue, did you manage to boot with text parameter?
Another thing would be to scan logs for gdm/lightdm, and update.rc
You keep saying "update.rc", what do you mean by that? Is it a file somewhere?
Acctually changed my mind. sudo stop lightdm; sudo start lightdm (or gdm should be first try)
There is threat, messy, but readable: http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-1846552.html
what I did is start gdm manually, it works. but I don't know how to have a gui start on each boot properly.
they (post) advise to purge lightdm and sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm, and add start gdm to /etc/rc.local
it looks like a workaround (that file is supposed to be used by a user rather than apps)?
Yes, it is bit odd. Still wondering in upstart cookbook.

I would try update.rc.d line you mentioned earlier - the question is if I should use gdm or lightdm (I personally don't care, I don't know which one would be better and gdm seems to work if started manually while I didn't try lightdm)
Ok, loosing head in it, ok try: sudo dpkg-reconfigure lightdm and choose gdm as default, boot.
